4.author: RadikulRAM
4.body:
It's a side effect of prescription stimulants which he claims to not take, but I'm prescribed amphetamine's (70mg Vyvanse & 20/40mg Dex daily dosage) and it's most likely due to that. Again he claims to not take them, then goes on marathon streams, supposedly gets a few hours sleep a day or two (probably can't even get that little sleep) and stutters like crazy. Also increased speed of speech is a common effect too.

I'll get these symptoms to a very minor degree if I don't take my meds for a few days and then take a large dose at once, forgetting that I need to ease into it.

4.author: memesauruses
4.body:
sorry if I'm intruding, but what is that medication for exactly? Is it to help you sleep or the opposite? I've been cutting out a lot of digital media as much as I can over past 3 years and honestly, it has given me my baby-like sleep back. 

Cut off all social media apps and No screens after 7 PM and lights out by 8, that's the only way I got my sanity back..

I hope people talk a lot more about this and hopefully no one else attempts to keep streaming like mr.cow its not good for the long run

4.author: RadikulRAM
4.body:
My medicine is a stimulant, so think of caffeine, cocaine, methamphetamine. My medicine is pure amphetamine.

I take it because I have ADHD - Inattentive type. To summarise, I get distracted from doing important things that I should do, but don't want to. To the point that it becomes impossible.

So for example, at work I have an expenses form that I need to fill out to claim back money I spent for work. I have to pay to park my company van, and sometimes I have to pay to fuel my company van also. The company will pay me back this money as long as I keep the receipts and enter the serial numbers into an excel sheet.

This is boring and tedious process, however it's important, because if I don't do it I'm literally losing a ton of money and won't be able to afford rent or food. Normal people can just do this. They hate it as much as me, but get it done and out of the way. I can do that if I'm properly medicated.

I haven't done my expenses form for the last two months. If I don't fill it out by the first week of February, I won't be able to claim an entire months expenses. I still haven't started it.

My medicine has been in short supply, and the reason why I'm prescribed an extended release and instant release medicine is because I have to top up my dosage throughout the day to keep up with chores etc. My top up medicine is the one out of stock.

My rooms a complete mess, much like XQC's often is, and I've almost run out of clean clothes. 

Also note how quickly I replied and wrote up paragraphs about my condition and yet I can't put a fraction of this effort towards something important such as my expenses form.

EDIT: At a therapeutic dosage, i.e a proper dosage that's not excessive or too little, it helps me sleep as it declutters my brain. However a tiny bit more will keep me up for hours. I once stayed up for 3 or 4 days, I'm not sure, I thought it was 2 days and was getting worried. I was taking my dosage more frequently than I should as I wasn't paying close attention. I started seeing shadow people on day 4 and freaked the fuck out as I literally got rushed at by a dark figure, which wasn't real. I recoiled in horror and screamed. I also had to buy water and stepped outside, then got freaked the fuck out by a leaf blowing by. It was only a day after I managed to put together how long I was up for.

At the same time I've gone 7 weeks without taking my medicine as I forgot to take it and forgot to pick up my prescription before.

4.author: memesauruses
4.body:
Thank you so much for sharing your challenges and helping us get more aware of what folks are going through.. i hope you're doing well and hoping you get through these challenges and win :) 

> This is boring and tedious process, however it's important, because if I don't do it I'm literally losing a ton of money and won't be able to afford rent or food. Normal people can just do this. They hate it as much as me, but get it done and out of the way. I can do that if I'm properly medicated.

the programmer in me just doesn't like the fact that your company has not automated this process yet - is that even possible? have you looked into Excel VBA macros or any general SQL querying? It might help you automate some of the logic you need to think about before say plugging in a value on a cell.. 

Try taking control back and see if you can try to improve your situation by teaching yourself something new and something that excites you and finally that can help you get out of it.. 

I hear your post so loud too.. I was just the same right when the pandemic started and I had to make massive sacrifices to get my life corrected and back on track. The only way that was possible was to limit my interactions with social media and try to keep calm and concentrate whatever little amount of focus I have into something I actually care about, not really my job perse, but anything that would make me happy..

it sucked so hard in the beginning, but I kept at it, because I had no other choice, sink or swim right? But eventually, it became a habit. Now, I am up at 3 AM daily studying, doing my own things, being calm and relaxed way before my work starts at 8.. gives me time to slowly catch up to the day before anyone else does..

I would highly recommend trying to force yourself to wake up a bit early every day and try not to fall asleep in the afternoon.. even if you do, limit it to 20 minutes so you don't go into deep REM sleep.. if you stay up all day after waking up at 4-5 AM, your body will automatically give out by 9 PM at the latest and  you will be sound asleep..

I think sleep and a good diet are KEY to anything.. We can't do SQUAT if we don't have any GOOD energy to expend..

I hope it gets better for you and everyone in this world. We're all with each other, we got this! <3 

xqcL

5.author: DallasOzeki
5.body:
Boom now you're unblocked. Recycling the same jokes is unique. 

But I deleted everything all the same because I need my karma. I agree with you about casual racism but I don't think 'acting black' is the culprit to any of this atleast not on its own, it could fully be beacuse he is half white which is something within the black community that is a legitimate problem.

"Blackness" is not always tied to acting a certain way, in fact blackness truly can be skin deep as many members of the black community often will treat lighter members differently, and for mixed race children they too can experience racism not just for acting a certain away but for their genetics, aka having a non black parent.

Dr. Umar Johnson's rant about Naomi Osaka is a great example of this, he calls into question her blackness not because of how she acts but because she chooses to represent her home country over Haiti and he eludes to her not wanting to do so because she does not have pride in her Haitian side. This is a firm example in my opinion as this could quite possibly be similar to how people treat NMP. I could be wrong but again, it's not always about acting a certain way.

In fact, overt racism is overt racism, for all we know Bruce could elude to Nick not being black simply because he's half black despite him identifying as black and so on. Gate keeping blackness in the black community again is a real and prevalent thing that does not always go back to acting but also origin.

"not black enough" goes beyond acting. I found the original poster's equation "jumping around and screaming" to be equated more with negative stereotypes they personally hold and to be truthful I think Bruce bringing up him being the black shield is more a strike on Nick not being fully black rather than how he acts.

No one should besmirch someone else because of their race, that's objectively true, but also, I'm saying that as a black person, it could be much deeper based on what I see in black spaces. As you may know, sometimes things can get pretty fuckin' racist. Now maybe Bruce has said "You act too white" to Nick, but all the same we agree on a fundamental level anyway.

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
the terms of service agreements might not be legally binding but they inform you of what's what, it's on you for not reading it and it shouldn't be on them for your lack of investment in that area

not that i like the shit that has become standard, given how i have truly no fucking clue how my data is handled in china as opposed to what happens in google, but idk what else they could do other than place big "fuck off" warnings when you go and install new shit

10.author: BagelsAndLoxx
10.body:
> but they inform you of what's what

That's actually one of the biggest problems with data harvesting, they typically lie about the width of their access and logs they collect. Facebook specifically got in trouble for this because they were lying about what they did with the data and who had access to it. 

Tiktok is currently in flux on whether or not it will be banned across the US because of their lying about what kinds of access the app has and data they collect. They are also lying about what they do with the data and who has access to it.

An example is an app saying they only collect in app data and whoami data. That's it. Except, they may also collect data on what other apps you use, how frequently you use certain apps (including phone, messaging, competition apps, etc), location information, what you may search on browsers... That'd be illegal and they would not put that in the terms and conditions.

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
yea and it sounds like those companies tend to get fucked, so who cares. one thing is if you told me they lied and nothing happened to them but it seems like they're gonna get shit for it, isn't that how it's supposed to go? or are we supposed to expect no bad actors?

for the good faith actors, aka those who don't lie (which are most), the terms are there, you are notified of what's what, if you don't read the terms of service then that's on you for being lazy. i don't expect them to put big warning signs when signing up to new shit when technically the terms of service are already there, doing that exact job. i can maybe get behind simplifying them or doing it like when you install a new app giving a short list of what's being accessed but that's still all in the terms of service.

10.author: BagelsAndLoxx
10.body:
> yea and it sounds like those companies tend to get fucked, so who cares. one thing is if you told me they lied and nothing happened to them but it seems like they're gonna get shit for it, isn't that how it's supposed to go? or are we supposed to expect no bad actors?

Facebook stock is currently worth $145. Tiktok is a billion dollar company that shares its harvested data with the CCP ... to this day.

So... no. they don't get fucked.

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
ok let me stupidly direct so that it doesn't get misinterpreted:

when i say "get fucked" i don't mean "go bankrupt and cease to exist" i mean "get caught doing it, get sued, and then forced to change", and in terms of the tiktok situation YOU said that it's being looked into in the US which means they're at least looking into the situation to see if they have to step in.

so yes, they seem to get fucked.

edit: this also is a completely other topic that has nothing to do with my original point. you tend to be notified of what they collect, it's not on them when YOU don't read it

10.author: BagelsAndLoxx
10.body:
>you tend to be notified of what they collect

The literal point i'm making is that you tend to NOT be notified by *shady companies* that offshore your data. And no, they do not get sued and forced to change, they pay fines as a cost of business.

You can put your head in the sand and say that these companies that fuck people over by selling their data around the world are getting penalized and sued, but they aren't. and they aren't losing the battle.

>so yes, they seem to get fucked.

Which company got fucked? I'd like some examples if you're going to make that claim.

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
>And no, they do not get sued and forced to change, they pay fines as a cost of business.

​

>Which company got fucked? I'd like some examples if you're going to make that claim.

Just this year META was sued by Ireland's Data Protection Comission over them effectively forcing you to personalized ads through their terms of service (which you are forced  to accept). while the fine that resulted from the ruling on the case was deemed rather low given the estimated fine that they should have gotten, they are still forced to pay the fine and if they lose the appeal they'll have to remove that section from their terms of service and giving users an opt in option.

1. they're being forced to change if the appeal is lost (as in they can't just "count it as a cost", they will have to change how they conduct their business in the EU at least)
2. they got fucked because they're going to pay a fine and have to change something that will lead them to lose more ad revenue.

can we NOW get on topic of the fact that MOST companies act in good faith, have shit right there in the terms of service and it's on YOU the user to read them?

10.author: BagelsAndLoxx
10.body: lol so they paid a cost of doing business... $210 million while they had profits in the billions. Their revenue is $27 billion. $210 million is just another bill on the stack.

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
Can you fucking read, they're being forced to CHANGE THEIR TERMS OF SERVICE if they lose their appeal and will lose on ad revenue due to the situation. You are hyper focusing on the word "fucked" when I already clarified that it means they get sued, they're forced to change and lose out on money.

Can we finally get on track to the original topic?

10.author: FlippinHelix
10.body:
yea, there's an appeal process, just like there are in most legal suits, and meta has a right to that appeal process just like any person or any other company in any other situation.

now can we back on track?

10.author: BagelsAndLoxx
10.body:
Back on track to what? You think it's okay as long as the scummy practice is listed in the terms and conditions. I'm saying that scummy companies don't always do that. You're saying they get fined. I'm saying the fines are a cost of doing business.

There's really not much more to discuss.

14.author: deb8er
14.body:
If you really wanna get into the weeds about kpop in a fucking lsf thread, sure, fuck it. 

I'm basically a boomer that listened to 2nd and 3rd gen kpop where groups were still experimenting with different styles and sounds an example would be T-ara that tried very hard to incorporate electronic dance music and BigBang who were all over the place from hiphop to ballads, overall most kpop of that time was influenced by western music but it tried to do its own thing and be different. 

Now there's so much homogeny between groups where the only thing that's different is the lyrics and voices. The music itself sounds so similar because that's what sells. Anytime a group tries to do something outside the norm like Dreamcatcher trying to introduce punk-rock elements or KARD with their dancehall foray they either struggle to survive or are forced back into the fold to sell enough to survive. 

Yeah I was obviously exaggerating with the milk comment but the 'style' you referenced isn't really present within the actual music, it's more the image, personalities and voices.

The fact that koreans just lack a solid underground scene that can publish and become famous outside of Korea and the music industry is really dominated by like 5-6 big companies who are just pumping shit out for quick profit hurts its development. There's no reason to take a chance on anyone doing anything original when you can create a group with some of the most liked personalities in kpop and milk it like cash cow(Got the Beat)

14.author: Kanaraketti
14.body:
People try to make K-Pop so much more than it is, and I say that as someone who regularly listens to it.

It's fucking pop music, it isn't some new genre pushing the boundaries of music theory, and that's completely fine. The songs are catchy, they're easy to listen to, it's great for background music at 15% volume. 

The biggest appeal for me is that it has nice vocals I can't understand, if the lyrics were in English I'd more than likely never listen, because they're so generic and ubiquitous and just, for lack of a better word, cringy. 

That's not to say there aren't artists/groups trying original ideas, but for the most part it's just cookie cutter, copy/paste, pop music, and sometimes that's all you need.

14.author: deb8er
14.body:
Every other pop scene out there has its own take on it. 

KPOP is just homogeneous as hell and it's worth complaining about especially if you've seen it go to shit before you.

14.author: Kanaraketti
14.body: Does "cookie cutter, copy/paste" not mean homogenous? And you can't tell me Blackpink sounds like Twice or IU sounds like Hyolyn, etc.

17.author: Sunkenking97
17.body:
Do you actually know the budget ? Also it’s a celebrity event vs a year long league. 

Besides the rules are different too so you can’t compare it longterm  viewership versus actual football without more events being made.

17.author: metaliving
17.body: I don't actually know the budget, but of course it's going to be low when compared with one of the best leagues in the world. I know it's not directly comparable, but it sends a strong message to the federation saying "invest here, this can be your new viewer pipeline now that younger generations care less about the sport".

17.author: Sunkenking97
17.body: Are young people actually less interested in football because I can’t find any article suggesting anything of the sort. Actually says it’s at an all time high.

17.author: metaliving
17.body:
Yes, they are. Even if the share numbers are similar to other age groups, younger generations are watching so much less TV that the same share represents a lot less spectators. And at the end of the day, share means less than actual people watching.

Here's an article (in spanish) where the president of the European Club Association says that Gen Z is less interested in football than previous generations: [https://www.20minutos.es/deportes/noticia/4611080/0/generacion-z-pierde-interes-futbol-redes-netflix-esports-mira/](https://www.20minutos.es/deportes/noticia/4611080/0/generacion-z-pierde-interes-futbol-redes-netflix-esports-mira/)

Some of the loss in viewership might be attributed to COVID too. Every generation watched less football during the past 3 years. But the key aspect when regarding the younger ones, is that they have so many alternative forms of media, that they're shifting away from TV, which is basically the only relevant medium for football, and with that, they're showing less interest in it.

With this in mind, RFEF and others might be interested in getting a foothold within some of these alternative mediums, like twitch. Instead of demanding the younger viewers come to TV, follow them to their prefered ways of consuming media. Which is what Kings League as very well capitalized on.

20.author: hi_im_leshy
20.body:
You made the claim that, when soju doesn't qualify for worlds, worlds viewership drops by 70-80 percent. 

I said that was false, because soju had never qualified for worlds until VERY recently. So you couldn't have possibly had data on  how much viewer ship was lost due to the lack of participation of someone that had never been in the first place.

20.author: hi_im_leshy
20.body:
Pedantic means to be overly concerned with minor details. 

If you think being called out on a very BROAD claim you made about years of worlds viewership being influenced by someone who never participated in it is me being "pedantic" you don't know what the word means. 

It's like if I say "NBA finals viewership drops by 70 percent everytime derrick rose doesnt participate" and someone points out "Yo derrick rose has never been to a finals" that's not them being pedantic thats me being an idiot.

22.author: TsukikoLifebringer
22.body:
You don't counter an analogy by making a worse one back. Mine applies to the situation, yours doesn't. Nobody is pointing at a liberal and saying "no that's not a liberal", we both agree that a liberal is a liberal. We both agree that an apple is an apple. Nobody's talking about oranges, we're talking about where the apple belongs on a spectrum, not which fruit it is.

At this point I'll just assume you're trolling.

22.author: xItacolomix
22.body:
Liberal is a righ-wing or in anothe word, apple is an apple and you are coming and saying it's left-wing/Orange, but nice try again in trying to dismiss the entire point. 

>At this point I'll just assume you're trolling.

It seem that you are the one trolling, not gonna lie.

22.author: TsukikoLifebringer
22.body:
Apple is an apple = liberal is liberal. You didn't just repeat what liberal is, you put it in a category. That's why your analogy fails where mind doesn't - mine is actually about categorizing things (countries/ideologies) into categories (right-wing/tropical) based on their position on a spectrum (hot-cold/rightwing-leftwing) from an extreme point of view (Antractica/Communist).

You just went "hurr durr, no, that's an apple, not an orange, silly you".

Either you're trolling or don't have experience arguing in good faith.

22.author: xItacolomix
22.body:
>Apple is an apple = liberal is liberal.

/facepalm

***It's like saying an apple is an fruit and you come in and say "No, it's a vegetable, how can't you see it?"***

Maybe that way you can understand, but i won't get my hopes up :)

The main problem here is that you think a left-wing or a right-wing change depending on the country you live on, which is not the case at all. It's as stupid as to think the Horseshoe theory exist or that depending who is writing something the right or left wing is something compeltely different.

USA is the center of Capitalism in the world, the Republicans are seeing as far-right wing and the Democrats are seeing as right wing. Like i said, you must be living under a rock to think otherwise, or i could say full of ideology.

Have a good day!

25.author: wellingtonriver
25.body:
You don’t understand. 

Asians are successful because of individual merit, not because they are Asian. Your asian doctor is a good doctor because they graduated medical school, not because they are Chinese. If you think your Asian doctor is more competent simply because they are Asian, that is Eugenics.

25.author: tmpAccount0013
25.body:
First of all, nobody said asians are more successful because they are asian.

Second of all, eugenics is the control of heritable characteristics, in some cases motivated by beliefs about race.  For example, prior to ww2 sweden had a eugenics program that discouraged people from breeding if they were unintelligent or ugly.  You're using the wrong word.  It's just racist.

25.author: wellingtonriver
25.body: Are you daft? I never said anyone said that, I said that’s the point OP was trying to make and you misunderstood and then blocked them

25.author: tmpAccount0013
25.body: So you agree that nobody said asians are better because they're asian, but disagree that my clarification this whole time... that nobody said that... is reasonable and you think I'm the one missing the point?

32.author: mozzzarn
32.body:
No… Thats just stupid. 

Some people with disabilities or injuries **might** not be suited for all machines. But thats not something that should have to be disclaimed every time you give general advise. 

The vast majority of people will do just fine training on machines designed in the last two decades. 

I’m 20x more worried someone will drop a free weight on their foot than getting hurt in a machine.

32.author: asfgfjkydr2145623
32.body: unless ur living in some 4th dimension where machines can adapt to each individual, its a matter of fact. general advise should absolutely include some form of warning that u should avoid machines that agitates ur joint. what the fuck are u talking about?

32.author: mozzzarn
32.body:
Humans are not as different as you think and machines are not as one dimensional as you think. Adjusting the seat/back and arm/leg is enough unless you have a unique problem. 

You are just incredibly out of touch with reality if you think people that use machines correctly get hurt. 

Cant engage further in your dilution unless you provide evidence for your outrageous claims.

32.author: asfgfjkydr2145623
32.body:
im sorry but wtf. muscle insertion & exertion points is gonna wary by huge margins. structural differences like the way ur ribcage is shaped is gonna impact the way ur lower back muscles operates with ur pelvis and in turn ur leg muscles along the line. i mean the list goes on for eternity. adjusting the fucking seat height or the tilt is akin to putting in a screw with a fucking sledge hammer.

that doesnt account for inherently damaging exercises. laying hamstring curls makes u use ur legs as a fishing cook with ur spine serving as the the fishing line. people have scientifically documented the horrors of leg extensions and leg presses. anything that internally rotates and elevates ur shoulder above or close to 90 degrees in the sagittal plane impinges ur supraspinatus every time, like every lateral raise machine ive seen does. wanna tear a biceps? preacher curls are ur best bet.

how old are u and have u ever been in a gym?

32.author: mozzzarn
32.body:
I will repeat myself. 

>	Humans are not as different as you think and machines are not as one dimensional as you think. 

Asking for credentials online is cringe, get of your high horse. But here you go: [140kg bench](https://streamable.com/5nlkn3) lifted 2 minutes ago. [Mozzz 14 jan](https://streamable.com/ri4yqg). You can find me lift 180kg if you dig through my old comments. 

With that out of the way. Can you link me any study backing your insane claim. 

Tens of millions people work out on machines every single day. There should be a a sea of studies showing the damage caused from them.

32.author: asfgfjkydr2145623
32.body:
just google "leg press injury pubmed" or any of the other things i mentioned. yes, there is a sea of studies documenting the damage caused by common gym equipment.

u can repeat urself all u want, it doesnt make it true.

32.author: mozzzarn
32.body: So you dont have anything.. As I thought.

33.author: hamB2
33.body: He wasn’t talking about the likelihood of going viral happening. He was talking about the what other benefits happen when you go viral. I get your point completely and agree it’s not something to base your life on I’m saying that jackpot when you do hit it is not just a piece of paper. It’s millions of dollars. That doesn’t mean playing the lottery is good but saying winning the lottery is not investing a lot of money in tickets just for a big piece of paper. So you’re missing his point. I’m sure if you asked him if he thought it was a good career choice he would say it’s not. Just don’t lie if you’re tying to dissuade people from doing it. Say what’s actually true.

33.author: ariZon_a
33.body:
>for every one person going viral there are untold millions just wasting their time. and for every one person who goes viral and makes a career off of it, the majority of the people who go viral barely get any interaction after the fact outside of the one video

it's fine if you go viral, but it's not even something that is going to bring money for every person. It's not millions of dollars, its 2-4 cents per view (and that's if you have a business account). 400$ for 10m views, what a career. it's only a minority that branch out and get rich.

im saying what's actually true, thank you very much

33.author: hamB2
33.body: Alright thanks for at least arguing in a relevant way that speaks to his actual argument. That it doesn’t necessarily lead to money.

33.body:
His argument is about the fact that it's not a waste of time.

Which it is for 99% of people on tiktok. So even if you go viral, you probably wont make money off it.

The whole app is a waste of time

33.author: hamB2
33.body:
Lol that wasn’t his argument. He made was very clear and concise with what he said. 

Lol “the whole app is a waste of time”. I think you just hate tiktok so you want to squash anything that seems positive. Good to know.

33.author: ariZon_a
33.body:
bruh we're just argumenting for no reason at this point.

i hope 2023 brings good things to you.

tiktok can bring positiveness to the table, but to me, it's a net loss for humanity.

that's just my opinion! and since it's an opinon it doesn't mean much in the grand scheme of things

but it's actually a big waste of time, and if you dont agree, it's fine, but you must be fine with wasting your time.

35.author: Dididididididib
35.body:
Actually doesn’t germany have presumed liability as well?

As a matter of fact, they were one of the earliest adopters of it. Meaning that the driver of the vehicle is liable.

35.author: Kamanthul
35.body: If this happens in Germany the cyclist is 100% at fault, you're not allowed to overtake someone on the right, which is the only way you'd get hit on your bike by a car making a right turn in your lane.

35.author: Dididididididib
35.body:
Not according to your law, Germany has presumed liability, which means the driver is at fault. liability is ruled out if the damage is not caused through the negligence of the vehicle driver.

Last time I checked, not shoulder checking to see incoming cyclers is negligence.

35.author: Kamanthul
35.body:
It wouldn't even matter because no sane person would overtake a car like that in Germany.

In that instance you would check your mirrors and see oh there's a cyclist behind me and then you'd proceed with your turn cause nobody assumes that someone is that fucking stupid to overtake on the right when the car is clearly indicating.

As I alrdy explained overtaking on the right is illegal, so who would really account for some dumbfuck cyclist who's busy looking at his phone instead of paying attention to the road.

35.author: Dididididididib
35.body:
It doesnt matter, according to the laws in your country the driver is at fault and will be liable for whatever happens to the cyclist. 

You can argue about it all you want, but it wont change the fact that in the eyes of the government, the way you think is incorrect.
